Title: json -> integer
Description: Extracts n'th element of JSON array (array elements are indexed from zero, but negative integers count from the end).

Title: json -> text
Description: Extracts JSON object field with the given key.

Title: json ->> integer
Description: Extracts n'th element of JSON array, as text.

Title: json ->> text
Description: Extracts JSON object field with the given key, as text.

Title: json #> text[]
Description: Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path, where path elements can be either field keys or array indexes.

Title: json #>> text[]
Description: Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path as text.

Title: jsonb @> jsonb
Description: Does the first JSON value contain the second? (See Section 8.14.3 for details about containment.)

Title: jsonb <@ jsonb
Description: Is the first JSON value contained in the second?

Title: jsonb ? text
Description: Does the text string exist as a top-level key or array element within the JSON value?

Title: jsonb ?| text[]
Description: Do any of the strings in the text array exist as top-level keys or array elements?

Title: jsonb ?& text[]
Description: Do all of the strings in the text array exist as top-level keys or array elements?

Title: jsonb || jsonb
Description: Concatenates two jsonb values. Concatenating two arrays generates an array containing all the elements of each input. Concatenating two objects generates an object containing the union of their keys, taking the second object's value when there are duplicate keys. All other cases are treated by converting a non-array input into a single-element array, and then proceeding as for two arrays. Does not operate recursively: only the top-level array or object structure is merged.
To append an array to another array as a single entry, wrap it in an additional layer of array, for example:

Title: jsonb - text
Description: Deletes a key (and its value) from a JSON object, or matching string value(s) from a JSON array.

Title: jsonb - text[]
Description: Deletes all matching keys or array elements from the left operand.

Title: jsonb - integer
Description: Deletes the array element with specified index (negative integers count from the end). Throws an error if JSON value is not an array.

Title: jsonb #- text[]
Description: Deletes the field or array element at the specified path, where path elements can be either field keys or array indexes.

Title: jsonb @? jsonpath
Description: Does JSON path return any item for the specified JSON value? (This is useful only with SQL-standard JSON path expressions, not predicate check expressions, since those always return a value.)

Title: jsonb @@ jsonpath
Description: Returns the result of a JSON path predicate check for the specified JSON value. (This is useful only with predicate check expressions, not SQL-standard JSON path expressions, since it will return NULL if the path result is not a single boolean value.)

Title: number + number
Description: Addition

Title: + number
Description: Unary plus (no operation); unlike addition, this can iterate over multiple values

Title: number - number
Description: Subtraction

Title: - number
Description: Negation; unlike subtraction, this can iterate over multiple values

Title: number * number
Description: Multiplication

Title: number / number
Description: Division

Title: number % number
Description: Modulo (remainder)
